title: Episcopal Academy rolls past Conwell-Egan
text:
Barlee, who also recovered a fumble as a linebacker, finished with 157 rushing yards and five touchdowns on 27 carries.
He scored on runs of 4, 4, 10, 3 and 30 yards. 
Episcopal quarterback C.J. McAnally finished 7 of 8 for 124 yards and a passing touchdown. 
Christian Feliziani, a lacrosse star committed to Ohio State, finished with 2 catches for 45 yards and a receiving score. 
Episcopal, which gobbled 319 yards of total offense, allowed Conwell-Egan just six first downs, with three coming via penalty yardage. 
For the Eagles, quarterback Kendall Jones finished with a touchdown in the air and on the ground. 
He also added 66 passing yards and 65 rushing yards. 
Jones also made the game's most impressive play, hurdling a defender en route to a 31-yard carry. 
C-E, however, was hurt by 10 penalties and 3 turnovers, and trailed Episcopal, 35-7, by halftime. 
The undefeated Churchmen open the Inter-Ac season next week. 
Head coach Todd Fairlie and his crew will host Malvern Prep, which boasts a win against two-time defending AAAA state champ, St. Joseph's Prep. 
The Eagles, who are tied atop Catholic League AA play with West Catholic, travel to Lansdale Catholic next week. 
Episcopal Academy 14 21 7 0 - 42 
Conwell Egan 0 7 0 7 - 14
